intro: Plocama dezfulensis, commonly known as the Dezful bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
